metadata: Chinese star maps | List of star maps | List of star maps
metadata_info: Concatenation of page title, section title and table caption.
cell: Found in a mural in a Neolithic Grave in Henan Puyang (河南濮陽西水坡新石器時代古墓) clam shells arranged in the shape of Big Dipper in the North (北斗Bei Dou) and below the foot, Tiger in the West and Azure Dragon in the East. Also showing Five Stars.
Wu Xian Star Map , (商巫咸星圖Shang wu Jian xing Tu)
Contained 44 Central and Outer constellations totalling 141 stars
Warring States Period grave lacquer box , (戰國初年湖北隨縣擂鼓墩曾侯乙墓漆箱)
Indicated location of Big Dipper and 28 Constellations by characters
Astronomic star observation , (天文星占Tian Wen xing zhan)
Contained 75 Central Constellation and 42 Outer Constellations, some said 510 stars in 18 Constellations
Shi Shen astronomy , (石申天文Shi Shen Tian wen) , aka. (石氏星经 Shi Shi Xing Jing)
138 Constellations and the name of 810 stars, location of 121 stars, some said it contains The 28 Lunar Ecliptic Constellations, 62 Central Constellations and 30 Outer Constellations
Han Comet Diagrams , (湖南長沙馬王堆漢墓帛書) , (彗星圖Meng xing Tu)
Different 29 different types of comets, also record and prediction of positions of Jupiter, Saturn, and Venus during 246-177 B.C.
Five Star Prediction Device , (安徽阜陽五星候占儀)
52 BC 甘露二年Gan Lu Er Ren
First remark of a constellation in observation in Korean history
The star `Pae`(a kind of comet) appeared in the constellation Wang Rang
First Ecliptic Armillary Sphere , (黄道仪Huang Dao Yi)
Han Grave Mural Star Chart , (洛阳西汉墓壁画) , (星象图Xing Xiang Tu)
Sun, Moon and ten other star charts
Han Dynasty Nanyang Stone Engraving , (河南南阳汉石刻画) , (行雨图Xing Yu Tu)
Depicted five stars forming a cross
Eastern Han Celestial Globe and star maps , (浑天仪) , (渾天儀圖注,浑天仪图注) , (靈憲,灵宪)
Sky Map , (浑天图) , and , Hun Tian Yi Shuo , (浑天仪说)
Reproduced Hun Tian Yi , (浑天仪) , and wrote , Hun Tian Xiang Shuo , (浑天象说)
Whole Sky Star Maps , (全天星圖Quan Tian Xing Tu)
c. 270 AD 西晉初Xi Jin Chu
A Unified Constellation System. Star maps containing 1464 stars in 284 Constellations, written astrology text
323 AD 東晉 前趙光初六年
level being used in this kind of device
Northern Wei Period Iron Armillary Sphere , (鐵渾儀)
Bei Weiplevel being used in this kind of device
Southern Dynasties Period Whole Sky Planetarium , (渾天象Hun Tian Xiang)
443 AD 南朝劉宋元嘉年間
used red, black and white to differentiate stars from different star maps from Shi Shen, Gan De and Wu Xian 甘, 石, 巫三家星
Northern Wei Grave Dome Star Map , (河南洛陽北魏墓頂星圖)
about 300 stars, including the Big Dipper, some stars are linked by straight lines to form constellation. The Milky Way is also shown.
Yu Jicai (庾季才) and Zhou Fen (周墳)
incorporated star maps from different sources
Tang Dynasty Whole Sky Ecliptic Armillary Sphere , (渾天黃道儀)
including Elliptic and Moon orbit, in addition to old equatorial design
1,585 stars grouped into 257 clusters or asterisms

based on Han Dynasty Celestial Globe, recalibrated locations of 150 stars, determined that stars are moving

Treatise on Astrology of the Kaiyuan Era , (開元占経,开元占经Kai Yuan zhang Jing)
Collection of the three old star charts from Shi Shen, Gan De and Wu Xian. One of the most renowned collection recognized academically.
Big Dipper , (山東嘉祥武梁寺石刻北斗星)

Hun Tian Yi Tong Xing Xiang Quan Tu, Suzhou Star Chart (蘇州石刻天文圖),淳祐天文図
created in 1193, etched to stone in 1247 by Wang Zhi Yuan 王致遠
1434 Stars grouped into 280 Asterisms in Northern Sky map
Yuan Dynasty Simplified Armillary Sphere 元代簡儀
Further simplied version of Song Dynasty Device
Japanese Star Chart 格子月進図
Similar to Su Song Star Chart, original burned in air raids during World War II, only pictures left. Reprinted in 1984 by 佐佐木英治
天象列次分野之図(Cheonsang Yeolcha Bunyajido)

Korean versions of Star Map in Stone. It was made in Chosun Dynasty and the constellation names were written in Chinese letter. The constellations as this was found in Japanese later. Contained 1,464 stars.
Japanese Star Chart 瀧谷寺 天之図

Chanshu Star Chart (明常熟石刻天文圖)
